not-player: You must be a player to use this command
setstab-desc: Sets the stability of the chunk you are in to a specific value. 1 is neutral stability, less is unstable and more is positive stability. Note that chunks are cubic, so higher or lower chunks in your column will have different values. Tip: Use .debug wireframe chunk to see chunk boundaries. Value range: -10000 to 10000.
resetstab-desc: Resets the stability of the chunk you are in to its default value.
resetstab-all-desc: Resets stability everywhere. WARNING: This is not reversible!! confirmCode is an optional parameter. Run this command without it first to get a confirmation code!
resetstab-all-warning: This command will reset stability in all chunks to default! THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!!!! Type /resetStability all {0} to confirm.
resetstab-all-error: Your code was incorrect. If you wish to reset all values, use code {0}.
resetstab-all-error2: No confirmation code exists yet. Type <i>/resetStability all<i> first to generate a confirmation code.
getstab-desc: Gets the stability of the chunk you are in.
get-stabglobal-desc: Gets the current global stability value, which is used when global stability is enabled.
get-stabglobaloffset-desc: Gets the current global stability offset value, which is used when global stability offset is enabled.
setstabmode-desc:
Sets the stability mode. There are three modes. Vanilla behavior, where chunks all have their own stability values. Global stability mode, where all chunk stability values are the same value. Global stability offset mode, where every chunk has an offset applied to it. Global offset mode will also still use values set for specific chunks before applying the offset. 

0 = Vanilla behavior.
1 = Global stability.
2 = Global stability offset.
setglobalstab-desc: Sets the stability value for all chunks to a specific value. Value range: -10000 to 10000.
setglobalstaboffset-desc: Sets a value to apply as an offset to all chunk stability values. Final stability values will be clamped to -10000 to 10000. Value range: -10000 to 10000.
